intro: Ptychotis verticillatoinundatum, commonly known as the spiral-leaved spurge, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its distinctive spiral arrangement of leaves around the stem, a feature that gives it its scientific name. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing on rocky soils. The leaves are typically fleshy and contain milky sap, which is a common trait among plants in the Euphorbiaceae family.
